node.title: SA Attorney-General had conflict of interest in knocking back Kangaroo Island port, committee told
node.alt: A woman wearing a black blazer, white top and glasses sits in front of a microphone. She is holding a binder of papers
node.description: South Australian Deputy Premier Vickie Chapman misled state parliament and should be referred to the state's ombudsman for a conflict of interest, a parliamentary committee is told.
node.content: ["South Australia's Deputy Premier and Attorney-General, Vickie Chapman, misled state parliament and should be referred to the state's ombudsman for a conflict of interest, a parliamentary committee has been told.", "Rachael Gray QC, the lawyer leading the inquiry into Ms Chapman's refusal of a deep sea port on Kangaroo Island, has made the recommendations on the final day of a two-week committee looking into whether she had a conflict of interest.", "Ms Chapman has vehemently denied she had a conflict in making the decision.", "The committee heard Ms Chapman owned land across the road from a forest which would have been felled if the port went ahead.", "The inquiry heard evidence from Ms Chapman, her adviser, public servants and Kangaroo Island Plantation Timbers, which proposed the port.", "Dr Gray \u2014 the counsel assisting the inquiry \u2014 said Ms Chapman should have had \"some doubt\" as to whether or not she had a conflict and she \"should have at least reported it to Premier\".", "Dr Gray also found Ms Chapman misled the parliament on at least three occasions\u00a0when talking about the matter.", "The committee will now prepare a report for the Speaker of the House of Assembly and it is likely the Deputy Premier will face a vote of no confidence when parliament resumes tomorrow.", "This morning, Premier Steven Marshall said he 100 per cent supported Ms Chapman.", "More to come."]
